greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest such sequence a that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j) for all i, j, where f(1) = 0, f(n) = -1 if n is an odd prime, and f(n) = A006370(n) for all other numbers.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
xref: See the crossrefs section in A322809 for a list of similarly constructed filter sequences.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 05 2019
